instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..
definitions.BKLT_EN: What is BKLT_EN? This signal enables backlight. Anytime you see a signal ending with “_EN” , that means this signal being present/high enables what it is referring to. This signal says “BKLT” before “_EN”. “BKLT” sounds short for “BACKLIGHT”, so it is safe to assume this signal enables backlight when present. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a backlight dont work damage liquid
threads.message:
hello i have this problem with macbook air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>

I fix fuse but i have only 8,5v, i try reset pram and smc but nothing...

can i help me? thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a backlight dont work damage liquid
threads.message:
As always, start checking XW7720 bridge.
Also look for corrosion between <CHIP>U7701</CHIP> balls.

Did you read the sticky thread about this problem?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a backlight dont work damage liquid
threads.message:
i need remove <CHIP>U7701</CHIP>? right?

about XW7720 i try this but i dont have this part

add pic 

[ATTACH type="full"]60941[/ATTACH]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a backlight dont work damage liquid
threads.message:
"i dont have this part"
It is there and looks good.

Post <SIGNAL>BKLT_EN</SIGNAL>/PWM levels.
Just in case, do PRAM reset 2-3 times.
